sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Duluwuwa kulasnǝm notǝbeye suron mbeji rifot yado mbu ma kam lardǝ diyaben isana ye ngǝmnzǝla ro sǝdin ma diwal wayabe ye men, na tes diobe gaworam motabe yen tǝdin shi doni tamoramnzǝ wajiya tuwandin ma, kuru raktǝ tes diobe tǝra wajiya wo son am 20,000 ro tes tǝdin.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Faraskǝram lardǝ South Koreabe dǝ kǝnasar sǝdǝna ro turin nasha fǝlangno adǝ kaltǝgǝbe lan bǝrni zam so zaktǝyi lan. Jami South Koreabe dǝ kǝla futu kura lardǝbe Moon Jae-Inye fitǝna dǝ ro katap gozǝgǝna dǝ buro salak dǝn gadetana.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Am Koreabe ngǝwu kura lardǝbe Moon'a sǝltǝ ro longorotaana kǝla awo do sandiye gomnatiye kalkal ro lamar fǝlangtǝ kwasa dǝye dǝ ro katap gotǝgǝ baa yen, au katap gotǝgǝnzǝ yingoro.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 23 dǝ, South Koreaye kes zauro shiro gana wo ba maye rifot sadǝna suro magǝ diyeube lan.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 29ya lan rifot tǝdǝna badiyaram kau 1 kǝntagǝ Aprilye lan am lardǝ diyaben isayin samma so magǝ indi ro sandiya ruwunza ro kortin au 'quarantine' ro tǝkkin.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Bayan fatowa hawarrabeye futa men, lardǝ South Korea be dǝ bana kuli kwasabe mbei la ba ro jaramnǝm kuru be matǝ na lardǝwa gade gade 121yen suwandǝna.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Lardǝ Iranye bayan cina lamar SARS-CoV-2ye buro salakye yim kau 19 kǝntagǝ Februerybe'a tawatcio bǝrni Qombe lan, na do gultǝ cidaram Nǝlewabe-a Ilmu Liyitabe-a yen, am indi yim shima dǝ'a dare ba'ada.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Katapwa datebe gomnatibe warmazǝgǝna ye suron bikke so kǝlele-a adabe so-a, kǝlele bikke tiyi mazaktabe so-a, kuru sala Zǝmabe so-a, kuru jamiya so, maarantawa kura kura so, maarantawa sǝnana so zaktǝ-a.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Lardǝ Iranbe ye tǝriliyon uwu sutuluwu kuli kwasabe dǝ kǝriutǝ nankaro.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Kura lardǝ Iranbe Hassan Rouhaniye kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 26 lan wono fasal au nyiya na'a fǝlangtǝ kwasa dǝye zamzǝna zaktǝbe ba wo, kuru kam so bas ruwunza ro tutuluyin.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Dawariya bǝlaguro ndikate bǝrniwaye gana ro diobe suro kǝntagǝ Marchbe lan warmatǝna, nǝm ngǝwu lenǝm are ndikate bǝrniwaye gotǝ kotǝna yaye saa bǝlin lardǝ faarisabe Nowruz dǝ fuwu ro tǝkkǝna dǝn.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Na'a ibadabe Shiawu be dǝ furumgata kara hatta kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 16be do. Iran dǝ daudi tartǝgǝ kuli kwasabe dǝye ro walwono ngawo Chinayen suro kǝntagǝ Februarybe lan.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Dawu manawa fane fanebe nǝm kǝrawu fǝlangtǝ kwasa dǝye lardǝ Iranbe lan zaktǝbe lan, lardǝwa meu ma kozǝna lamarra kwasadǝye lardǝnzabe Iran men cowanda ro maza nozana kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 28 be lan, adǝye fǝlejin fǝlangtǝ kwasa deye dǝ kessa 388 do gomnati lardǝ Iranbe ye bayan cina dǝga nǝm kǝrau lan kozǝna yim kau kǝntagǝ be shima dǝga.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Fato majilaskube Iranbe dǝ zakkatǝ, majilasku 23 dawu sandi 290 kuli kwasa dǝye dǝ tiyinzan mbejiye bayan tǝdǝna kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ ǝ.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 12nna, karapka Hakkuwa Adammanabe Wutabeye huwumawa Iranbe ro longorowotǝ am hakkuwa adammanabe faitǝma satana dǝ kolza ro gadetǝ suro nǝlewaben nanka ro, kuru loktu laa ro fǝrzǝnawa do koltiya sandǝna so dǝye kolza.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Shiye (karapka dǝye) wonona'a zakkata jili fǝrzǝn ye dei so lan fujiwo kuli kwasabe dǝ tartǝgǝbe dǝ zauro ngǝwu, kuru na shima dǝ cistǝgǝ liyitabe ngǝla ba.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 15'a, gumnati Iranbe ye kǝrmu am 100be ye kau fallan bayan cina, shi do nǝm ngǝwun shiyeyi ba ma kau rekod ro tǝkkǝna.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Gananzǝ yaye siyasawu-a cidawu gomnatibe-a 12 yedei sosonuna kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 17ya.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 23 lan, Iranye dǝ awa wo son kessa bǝlin 50 sowandayin kuru minti meu wo son kǝrmu bǝlin tuwandin dalil koronabairosben.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Gultǝ cidawu WHObe yen, kessa do lardǝ iranbe ye bayanzǝna jirebe dǝ adǝgai dǝ'a gade gade 5 yedei lan kozǝna.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Kuru ka'idawa wusabe lardǝ U. Sye Iran ro gǝnazǝgǝna dǝye raktǝ nasha kungunabe tartǝgǝ kwasa dǝye ro katap gotǝgǝ Iranbe zauro lezǝna.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: Komishina kura majalis lardǝwa dunyabe (UN) Hakkuwa Adammanbe dǝye ka'ida wusabe nasha arzǝyi be dǝ gana haptǝ lardǝwa wawa dǝye zauro zamzǝna so ro wono, lardǝ Iranbe kunten.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Fǝlangno kwasa dǝbe dǝ lardǝ Italybe ro kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 31nna tartǝgǝ lewono, sa am lardǝ China be indi fomtǝ shim katabe dio ro Rome ro lezana dǝ sandiya jarabsa kwasa tiyinzan mbeji ro walzvna lan.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Lamarra tini ngǝwutǝ badiyono, adǝye gomnati Italybe'a sǝkkǝ bǝlaguro maarabe lardǝ Chinabe ro letǝbe -a kǝnshebe-a samma hapkono.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Jam'u lamarra COVID-19be gultǝna ma dǝ'a letǝnyi dare tuwandǝna, lamarra tawattǝgǝna 16 lan badiyono Lombardy lan kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 21. Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 22, majalis ministawabe dǝye ka'ida bǝlin warma'ano fǝlangtǝ dǝ kaltǝgǝ ro, suro dǝn am 50,000 ma kozǝna korra gade gade 11 lan anǝm Italybe lan sandiya ruwunza ro kǝretǝna.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Firayim minista Giuseppe Coteye wono, "na'a kwasa dǝ fǝlangzǝna so dǝn, gawo-a luwo-a mowonjimba" wono

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Cida so bikke tiyi mazaktabe so samma so buro man haptǝna nasha wa sandima dǝn”. Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 4'a, gumnati Italybe ye maaranta so jami'a so samma oda zaktǝbe ceno sa Italy lan kam 100 bazana dǝn.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Kǝlelewa bikkebe kura kura, suro dǝn bikke dekkel shiye Seie A dǝ mbeji, samma so cinna zakkata lan tǝdin hatta kǝntagǝ Aprilbe do, amma kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 9 dǝ bikke samma hapkatǝ gananzǝ yaye ngawo kǝntagǝ fal yedei do.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 11be lan, minista kura Contebe cidawa kasuwu be samma dapkono supamaket so shagowa kurun ladobe so dawun ba ro. Kǝnatgǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 6'a, aaranta shiro "Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) sayin dǝye ka'idawa laa mowonzǝ faidatin ma baksǝ sutuluuna.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 19'a lan, Italybe China'a kowono nasha kǝrmu koronabairos'a leyata ngǝwuye lan dunya samma son ngawo bayan kǝrmu kam ǝ,405 dalil fǝlangno dǝyen sadǝna ye lan.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 22, lardǝ Russiabe ye maara samibe lǝgar karewa litaribe-a Italy ro zuwazǝna be bayan tǝdǝna.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ April be kaunzǝ 5 lan, lamarra tawattǝgǝna 128,948, kǝrmu am 15,887be-a, kuru am 21,815 ngazana-a Italy lan tuwandǝ, lamarra dǝye ngǝwunza so nasha Lombardy be lan kasharu.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Rifot au bayan CNNbe laaye wono kǝlkǝlno nǝm ngǝwu jumla am ngǝlinza lezǝna be-a kuru raktǝ am kuli kwasaye tiyinzan mbeji jarab nǝm kuru baaye-a dǝ ngǝwutǝ kǝrmube banazǝyin.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Lardǝ United Kingdom be futu kuli kwasaye dǝ ro katap gozǝgǝna dǝ shiro zau gǝnyi wo ba suro lardǝwa zamtǝna samma son, kuru kau Marchye kaunzǝ 18nna saa 2020 wow ro, gomnati Britaniya be ka'ida ammo cintutǝbe-a kǝla sǝgǝri ro tulo-a ammo koksǝgǝnyi.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Adǝye sǝkkǝ, gumnati dǝ shrǝwu kada suwandǝna kǝla awo do duwaro katap gotǝ baa au salak ro lamar dǝ'a kǝnta ro turin yen zǝktǝ jama meuye ro cistǝgǝ baa. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 16nna, Minista kura Boris Johnsonye kǝla bǝlaguro mbu gǝnyi-a am so'a kǝla kǝltǝ-a yen sǝmo gǝrtǝ warmajio, shawari ceno am so fatonn cidaza na mowonjin lan kuru na'a jili kulob so, na bǝri kǝmbuye so, fato fimye so ro am sobe kata ro.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 20'a, gomnati dǝye duwa ro zaktǝ na'a kǝji fantǝbe jili kulob so kuru fato tiyi mazaktabe so warma'ano, kuru wadǝ gozǝna ci 80% cidawube samma so ro kǝntagǝ wo son pam 2,500 cin fitǝna cida baaye kaltǝgǝ ro. Kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 23nna, minista kura dǝye katappa kam so ro cintutǝbe burobe ma'a nǝm zau lan kozǝna warmajio, samno kam indiya kozǝna be dapkatǝ kuru bǝlaguro-a cidawa diya lan tǝdin samma so dapkatǝ illa awo do zauro mbu ma.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Katapwa burobe'a gadezǝna, daptǝ anyi dalewaye mbu ro sadǝna am so ro samun kamtǝgǝ men-a kuru samno amma tartǝ-a men.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Kasuwuwa ngǝwu so ro huwom zaktǝye sadǝna, kasuwuwa do "mbu" ro turin dawun ba ro, suro kasuwuwa mbuyen sufamaket so, na kurunna ladobe so, banki so, shagowa karewa ladobe so, fatowa kǝndawube so, gareji moto yasabe so.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 20'a, lamar COVID-19be buro salakye suro kǝriye Washingtonbe do anǝm fǝtezǝna Pacificbe lan dǝgana dǝn tawattǝgǝna tiyi kam laa Wuhan lan kau kǝntagǝ Januarybe 15'a waltǝna be lan.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Awo shiro "White House Coronavirus Task Force" sayin dǝ kau kǝntagǝ Januarybe 29'a kokkatǝ.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Kau kǝntagǝ Januarybe 31, gumnati Trumpbe ye duwasashi nǝlewa jamabe warmajio, kuru gawo bǝlagurowu lardǝ Chinaben isayin dapkono.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 28 saa 2020 be lan, Daudi Kwasa Kaltǝgǝbe (CDC) - cidaram nǝlewa jama meube kurama gomnati U.S.be ye- sandiya awonza kwasa dǝ jarabtǝye kaanza satandǝna sa warmajiya.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Adǝgai sadǝna dǝ man yaye, United States dǝ jarabtǝ dio dǝ zauro letǝ kashingo sǝdǝna, adǝ ye nǝm ngǝwu fǝlangtǝbe dǝ gǝrazǝna loktu dǝn.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Jarabtǝ dio dǝ zauro ngawo ro waltǝna dalil awo jarabtǝbe batti gomnati lardǝbe sǝtandǝnayen suro kǝntagǝ Februarybe lan, gumnati lardǝbeye awo jarabtǝbe gomnatibe gǝnyi faidatǝ ro amari kǝnjo baa (sandi doni na maaranta so, komfoni so, kuru litari soye dǝ) hattaa datǝgǝram kǝntagǝ Februarybe do, kuru awowa sandi ro wutǝgǝ do kammo jarabtǝ sadin do kǝbkaataa ma-a hatta badiyaram kǝntagǝ Marchbe do (amari doktabe mǝradǝtǝna ngawo dǝn)

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 27'a lan, jarida Washington post"ye bayan am 4000 ma sǝtǝnyi ro jarabtǝ tǝdǝnabe cina suro United Statesbe lan.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 13 lan, jeruda "Atlantic" am 14,000 ma sǝtǝnyi jarabtǝna be rifot au bayan cina.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Kvntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 22, jerida "the Associated Press"ye:" Am ngǝwu alama kwasa dǝbe'a ye kuru amari doktabe-a ye awa kada au kau kada ro jarabtǝ sandiro dio jezayin"ye bayan au rifot cina. Ngawo kǝrmu buro salakye dǝye rifot au bayan kǝriye Washingtonbe lan tǝdǝna be lan kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 29'a lan, gomna Jay Inslee be ka'ida kǝnda duwasashibe shiro 'state of emergency' sayin dǝ kokono, katap dono kǝriyewa gade so ye zasa'a sadǝna ma.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: Maarantawa nasha Seattle be dǝn darasuwa kollada kau kǝn 3 me kǝntagǝ Marchbe'a, kuru dau dau kǝntagǝ Marchbeye lan maarantawa lardǝbe samma zaktǝ sadin. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 6 saa 2020be lan, United States ro jam'u doktawa kuli kwasabeye maaranta Imperial College Londonbeye shawari sadǝna banna do coronavirus bǝlin dǝye lardǝ dǝ ro sǝdin dǝ kadarzǝ suru.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: Yim shima daa dǝman, kura lardǝye Trumpye "the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act" ro mukko cikko, shi doni kunguna $8.3 billion dolaye cina duwasashi ro cidaramma lardǝbe so ro kunguna yio ro fǝlangtǝ adǝ ro katap gotǝ ro.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: Cidaramma soye bǝlaguro cidawube dapkada, samno so ba ro cedo, kuru cidawunza'a fato lan cidaza sa ndǝlamzaana.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Kǝlelewa bikkebe-a 'seasons' au bikke loktu loktu lan tǝdin so ba ro tǝdǝna. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 11nna, Trumpye lardǝwa Europebe kada ro bǝlaguro daptǝ warmazǝna, United Kingdom dawun ba ro, kau 30 ro, kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 13 na baditin.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: Wazǝnanzǝ-a, daptǝ dǝ faraksǝgǝ lardǝ United Kingdom-a Ireland-a kǝljio.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 13 na, shiye duwasashi lardǝbe warma'ano, adǝye kungunawa lardǝbe mbeji ro cido fitǝna dǝ ro katap gotǝgǝ ro.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 15'a baditin, kasuwuwa kada zakkada au awa'a do kazayin dǝ fuluada U.S. samma son tartǝgǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ fulutǝ nankaro.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Kǝnatagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 17'a, wawa kwasadǝbe dǝ kǝriyewa 50 samma so-a kuru 'District of Columbia'-a son tawattǝna. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 23, bǝrni New Yorkbe dǝn lamar koronabairos be 10,700 ye bayan tǝdǝna, lamarra South Koreabe samma so'a kozǝna.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 25nna, gomna dǝye kam so ro cintutǝ dǝ alama faidajinye mbeji wono, adadu lamarra kwasadǝye gana tǝ sǝdin kau 2.0 lan kau 4.7 ro.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 28nna lan, bǝrni New Yorkbe lan kessa au lamarra 32,308 tawattǝna, kuru am 672 baza sau kuli kwasabe dǝyen. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 26, United States dǝ dunya lan lardǝ shiro lamarra kwasa koronabairos be tawattǝna ngǝwu lan saadǝna ba, China-a Italy-a kunten. Kǝntagǝ Aprilbe kaunzǝ 8'a lan, lamarra tawattǝna 400,335 daa United States lan, kuru am 12,841 baza.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Gultǝ fatowa hawarraben kau 30 kǝntagǝ March be lan, kura lardǝ U.S.be Trumpye kashimowa kam so ro cintutǝbe dǝ kǝntagǝ April be kaunzǝ 30 ro gǝrjo.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: Yim shima dǝga, litari maara njiye diyel duwu (1000) falla shiro "USNS Comfort" sayin dǝ, bǝrni New Yorkbe lan jinjir fiyono.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Aprilbe kaunzǝ kǝn 3 me'a, U.S. dǝ suro awa 24 ben kǝrmu dalil koronabairosbe 884be rekod ro sǝkkna.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: Kǝriye New Yorkbe lan lamarra dǝ am 100,000 ma isǝ kozǝna yim 3 kǝntagǝ Aprilbe'a. Fato bǝl (ma'ana kǝrmai Trumpbe) dǝ zortǝna kǝla kuwa kwasa dǝye dǝ salak ro gozǝnayen kuru kawuli so dǝ'a kaltǝgǝyen sa cidawu nǝlewabe-a ilmuwu-a ro amari cina bayanna jama meube-a hawarra kǝla kulikwasabe dǝ'aye dǝ ofis banama kura lardǝbe Mike Pence men satuluyin sǝna dǝn.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Trumpye futu fitǝna dǝ'a kalzǝgǝna dǝye kǝlan am so gade tana (laaye ngǝla sayin laaye batti sayin).

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Cidawu U.S.be kura kura laa-a manawu so-a U. Sye awowa zauro mǝradǝtǝna na gaden ikkonzǝ dǝ zorzana, karewa liyitabe zauro mǝradǝtǝna China lan kudon kunten.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Diwalla bǝlagurobe kushetǝ laa faidatǝna zawal tartǝgǝbe-a kuru futu tartǝgǝyinna asutǝ ro kuru suro"The Journal of Travel Medicine"be lan baktǝna dau dau kǝntagǝ Januarybe saa 2020 lan.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Bayan saa 2018 be "International Air Transport Association" ye wono, bǝrniya Bangkok be-a, Hong Kong be-a, Tokyo be-a, Taipei be-a sandima bǝlagurowu Wuhan be ngǝwu sandiro gasaana wo.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Dubai-a, Sydney-a, Melbourne -a ye bayan tuwandǝna na zauro su-a am Wuhan lan cizayin ye ngǝwu ro lezayin.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bayan tuwandǝna lardǝ Bali dǝ na shiro raktǝ gana'a wo ba nasha dawari yen suro bǝrniwa (20) findi su'a am soye lezayin yen, suro adǝyen bǝrniwa suro Australia be so dǝ sandi ro dawarrata wo ba. Lardǝ Australia be ye fasalnzǝ koronabairos ro katap gotǝgǝbe duwasashibe suro kǝntagǝ February be kaunzǝ 7 citulo.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Awo ngǝwu kǝla COVID-19 yen kuwa yaye fuwun fodutin wono, kuru Australia ye kungur bǝla be-a fantǝgǝ-a ro kaltǝgǝ ro duno ikko men wawa dǝ ro katap gojin wono.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 21nna, Australia lan duwasashi nasha nzǝliwo adammanabe warmatǝna.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Lamar lenǝm arebe kortǝ au ruwunzǝ ro tulo zauro faidazǝna ma do bǝrni Wuhan-a Hubei-a ye dǝye sǝkkǝ, lardǝwa kadaye dawari am lardǝnzabe-a jamiwunza diflomasiyabe-a nasha shima dǝn tulobe sadǝna, taganasma ro maara lardǝ shima dǝye aaritǝ men, huwumawa Chinabeye sandi ro amari yio lan.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: Lardǝ wa Canada-a, United States-a, Japan-a, India-a, Sri Lanka-a, Australia-a, France-a, Argentina-a, Germany-a kuru Thailand-a dǝ suro lardǝwa do buro salak yen am nza satuluwunaben kasharu.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: Lardǝ Pakistanbe dǝ amnza lan nduma China lan satuluyimba wono.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 7, Brazilye amnza 34 au yallanza so-a satuluwu kuru am lardǝ Polandbe diyeu-a, kam Chinabe falla, kam Indiabe falla kǝlza satuluwuna.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Am Polandbe dǝ-a, Chinabe dǝ-a, kuru Indiabe dǝ-a dǝ Poland lan zǝbkada, na do maara Brazilbe dǝ dazǝ do kuru zawal nzǝ Brazil be dǝ jia

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Am Brazilbe do Wuhan ro lezana dǝ sandiya na askǝrrabe batau Brasilia be lan ruwunza ro korrada.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Yim shima dǝ'a dǝ man, am Canadabe 215 (maara buroye dǝn sandi 176, kuru sandi 39 maara kǝn indime do gomnati U.S.be ye aarizǝna dǝn) sandiya Wuhan lan satuluwu CFB Trenton ro ceudo, sandiya magǝ indi ro ruwunza ro kortin daji.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 11, maara gade am Canadabe 185 gozǝ Wuhan lan cizǝ CFB Trenton ro isǝna.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: Huwumawa Australiabe amnza 277 kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 3-a 4-a lan sutuluwu "Christmas Island Detention Center" ro suwudǝna, na shima dǝ na amma ruwunza ro kortǝbe ro sadǝna, kuru na dǝn kau meu diyeri (14) ro sandiya ruwunza korrada.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Maara am tulobe New Zealandye kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 5 Auckland ro kedo; fasinjawanzǝ (laa Australiabe-a Pacificbe-a kunten) sandiya na askǝrra njibe Whangaparoa, yala Aucklandbe lan ruwunza ro korratǝ.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 15, United Statesye am Americabe suro maara njibe shiro "Diamond Princess" sayindǝn sutuluyin sǝ warmajio.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Februarybe kaunzǝ 21, maara am Canadabe 129 do sandiya maara njiye 'diamondPrincess' lan gozǝna dǝTrenton, Ontario lan zǝbkono.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe badiyaramnzǝn, gumnati Indiabe amnzǝ Iran lan tulo badiyono. Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 14'a maara 'South African Airways'be gumnati South Africabe aarizǝna maye am lardǝ dǝye 112 gozǝ lardǝnza ro kalaksǝ.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Kau cizayin ro am dǝ ro kulashi liyitabe sadǝna, kuru am South Africabe diyeu alamawa coronavirusye fǝlezayindǝ sandiya ngawon kollatǝ fujiwo wata ro.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Am South Africabe tiyinzan kwasa dǝ ba ro tawattǝna bas lardǝnza ro kalaksa.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Tamoramwa tes au jarabtǝbe sadǝna dǝye am South Africabe samma so-a, cidawu suro maarabe dǝ-a, dǝrebawa maarabe dǝ-a, cidawu otelbe dǝ-a, dalewa dǝ-a kuru askǝrra do cidawa bana kanjimaliye sadǝna dǝ-a, sandi doni naptǝ katap fujiwo wataben, sandi samma kau 14 ro cidiya wutǝbe-a kuru ruwunza ro kortǝ-a lan dasaana na shiro "Ranch Resort" sayin dǝn, kunten samma cingono.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 20'a, lardǝ United Statesbe ye hangal hangal lan askǝrranzǝ Iraq lan gǝrtǝ badiyono dalil wawa dǝyen.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 5, cidaram lamar lardǝwa diyabe Chinabeye wono lardǝwa 21 (suronzan Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad-a Tobago, Egypt-a Iran-a kunten) bana China ro zuwazana.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Fuwurawa maarantabe Chinaye jami'a wa Amerikabe lan kǝrazayin soye mukko kǝlza bana nasha Chinabe zauro kuli kwasabe dǝye zamzǝna ro zuwatǝ ro, ngawana kǝl jam'u laa be nasha Chicago kurabe dǝn awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe shiro N95 sayin dǝ sandi 50,000 litariwa nasha Hubei ro zuwatǝ ro kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 30. Karapka bana kanjimalibe "Direct Relief"ye, FedEx-a kǝla kǝlza awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe-a awowa gade kǝla nzǝliwobe-a, suro dǝn awo mukko ro ikkobe-a gǝmaje cidabe-a so samma mbeji, litari Wuhan Union Hospital sayin dǝ ro zuwa'ada, maara lan duwasashi lan zuwatǝ men, kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 30.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 5, Bill-a Melinda Gates-a ye bana dola miliyon 100 WHO ro cin sǝ warmazana, kungǝna dǝn kulashi kalimi-a kurun kwasa dǝbe fando a tǝdin kuru "jumla amma suro fujiwoben dasaana Africa-a Asia lan dasaana" so ro.

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: Interaksyonbe bayan cina gomnati Chinabe ye bana awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe sandi 200,000 lardǝ Philippinesbe ro cina yim kǝn 6 kǝntagǝ Februarybe'a, ngawo Senator Richard Gordonye Wuhan ro awo shima dǝ sandi miliyon 3.16 zuzǝgǝnayen.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Yim kǝn 19be kǝntagǝ Februarybe-a, karapka "Singapore Red Cross"ye China ro bana do tamanzǝ dola miliyon 2.26 zuwajin sǝ warmazǝna.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: Japanye awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe miliyon fal Wuhan ro bana ro cina, Turkiyaye karewa liyitabe zuwazǝna, Russiaye karewa liyitabe ton 13 ma kozǝna Wuhan ro zuwazǝna, Malaysiaye bana awo mukko ro ikkobe sandi miliyon 18 China ro cin sǝ warmazǝna, Germanybe karewa liyitabe jili kada gǝmzǝgǝna suronzan gǝmajiya Hazmatbe sandi 10,000 mbeji, kuru United Statesye bana karewa liyitabe ton 17.8 China ro cina kuru wadǝ dola miliyon 100be gade gozǝna lardǝwa zamtǝna so ro. Ngawo lamarra dǝ China lan gana ngalau ro walzǝnayen, lardǝ dǝ lardǝwa gade wawa dǝye baksǝ kolzǝna ro bana zalla zuzǝyin.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ March be lan, China-a, Cuba-a, Russiaye karewa liyitabe-a goniya-a lardǝ Italybe ro zuwazana sandiya banaza ro kǝla fǝlangno coronavirusye dǝn.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: Kasuwu ma kura Jack Ma ye awo jarabtǝbe sandi miliyon 1.1 -a, awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe sandi miliyon 6, kuru gǝmajeya nzǝliwobe sandi 60,000 Addis Ababa, Ethiopia ro zuwajio, majalis lardǝwa Africabe ye samzǝ nankaro.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Shiye kuru dare waltǝ awo jarabtǝbe sandi 5,000-a, awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe sandi 100,000-a, injin kamma banazǝgǝ yinjin sandi 5-a Panama ro zuwazǝna.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: Maye kuru Canada ro bana karewa liyitabe cina. Lardǝwa "The Netherlands"-a, Spain-a, Turkiya-a, Georgia-a, kuru Czech Republic-a ye kangurno baanza kǝla awowa ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe-a kuru awowa jarabtǝ diobe lardǝ Chinabe lan tǝnandin dǝyen fǝlezana.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Misallo, Spain ye awo koronabaros mbeji la ba ro ngalnǝm kurube China lan tǝnandǝna sandi 58,000 do nǝm kalkalnza ci 30%'a bas ma gǝrzǝna, lardǝ Netherlandsbeye awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe Chinaye sandi 600,000 do batti dǝ waltǝ bowozǝ.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: Belgumye awo c-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe faidajimba ma sandi 100,000 waltǝ bowozǝ, ca Chinabe sa kasharu do dare Columbiabe ro asuada.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Nasha falyen, bana Chinabe dǝ mukko ndin nasha'a Latin Americabe-a Africa-abe lan tǝmowona. Kǝntagǝ Aprilbe kaunzǝ 2, bankǝ dunyabeye cidawa bana duwasashibe sǝsangǝna lardǝwa fuwutv sadin banatǝ ro.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: WHOye ngǝnǝwu huwumawa Chinabe sungorǝna kǝla futu wawa dǝ'a ciza kalzaanayen.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: WHOye nǝm gade fǝlangtǝ SARSbe ndi kate saa 2002–2004, sa huwumawa Chinabe-a ashirtǝgǝ do kwasa dǝ'a kaltǝgǝ'a na fal ro saptaa ro dapsǝna'a lan zortǝna dǝ-a, kuru fitǝna kǝrmaaye do gomnati daube dǝye "bayanna kǝla kǝla lan mbeji ro sǝdǝna hangal za faitǝ ro batallawa saa bǝlin tǝkkǝna dǝyen" dǝ'a gǝre'zǝna.

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Yim 23 kǝntagǝ Januarybe'a, gomnati daube dǝye katap lenǝm are Wuhan lan dapsǝna dǝ ro jawawu yio lan, wakkil WHObe Gauden Galeabe adǝ "tawadǝ ro awo WHObe shawarinzǝ cina ma gǝnyi", amma adǝye "alama kura fǝlezǝna wawa dǝ'a na fal ro saptǝgǝ ro himmatǝna na do zauro kwasa dǝ ngǝwu lan" kuru shiye adǝma dǝ "tarihi nǝlewa jama meube lan awo tǝmatǝnyi" wono.Kǝntagǝ Januarybe kaunzǝ 30, ngawo faltǝgǝ ndi kate kamma kammayen Chinan diyan tawattǝgǝna yen kuru ngǝwutǝ adadu lammarra kwasa dǝye lardǝwa gadebe-aye sǝkkǝ, WHObe fǝlangtǝ kwasa dǝye dǝ Duwasashi Nǝlewa Jama meu be Dunya Samma Lezǝna (PHEIC) ma sǝ bayangono, PHEIC kǝn arakkǝme ngawo katap dǝ saa 2009yen gotǝnayen sa wawa "swine flu"be lan.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: Darekta kura karapka nǝlewa Dunyabe (WHO) Tedros Adhanombe wono dalil PHEIC adǝ gǝnatna dǝ shima "fujiwo kwasa dǝye lardǝwa duno gana-a do nzunduwanza nǝlewabe ngǝla ba'a ro tartǝgǝ''.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Kǝla bǝlaguro daptǝyen bayan cin lan, Tedrosbe wono "dalil katappa de sǝl lamarra bǝlaguro-a kasuwu-a dunyabeye ro gayin ma dǝ ba" kuru shiye wono "WHOye kasuwu-a fomtǝ-a daptǝ dǝ ro ngawo sǝkkǝye rǝgǝnyi ".

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 5, WHObe dunya ro longorotǝgǝna kunguna dola miliyon 675be bana sadǝ dawari lardǝwa duno gana'abe nanka ro, duwa duwa ro lardǝwa do "nzunduwanza am kuli kwasabe dǝ sandiya sǝtana dǝ asutabe ba, kwasa dǝ mbeji man".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: Tedrosbe kuru bayannanzǝ lan gulzǝna "ande dunonde dǝ na'a duno ba do kǝltena'a fallo" daji kuru dunya ro longorotǝna "ku ro zar fiza au bali adǝ'a kozǝna cenin”. Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 11, WHObe samno hawarwube laan kwasa dǝ ro su COVID-19be cikko.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: Yim shima dǝ'a, Tedrosye wono sekatare kura majalis lardǝwa dunyabe Antonio Guterresye "duno nzundu UNbe samma so katap gotǝg" lan faidatǝ ro kasatsǝna wono.

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: Dalil adǝyen Jami Kǝla Fitǝnabe Kuruma UNbe kokkatǝ, adǝye katap gotǝ majalis lardǝwa dunyabe fasaltǝ kolzǝna, shi doni gultǝ WHObe lan sandiya kolzǝ "hangal katappa nǝlewabe ro sadin sa cidaramwa gade soye nǝm goninza nasha banna do fǝlangno adǝye kǝnda jama meube-a, arzǝyibe-a kuru fuwutǝ-a ro sǝdin ma dǝ ro hangal sadin".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 14'a, jami cidabe ngawana kǝl WHObe-a China be-a kokkatǝ cidawu gonizana dunyabe-a WHObe-a suro Chinabe lan banaza cistǝgǝ fatobe-a "kwasadǝye nǝm zaunzǝ-a kam ro faltǝgǝnzǝ-a "bangnǝm kuru-a, samno allamtǝbe cidaramwa lardǝbe kura kura-a sototǝ men kuru ziyara fili ro yadǝm kulas nǝm "katapwa gotǝna dǝye faidanza suro kǝriyebe lan kuru ro, bǝrni-a bǝla dia-a son". Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 25, "dunya dǝ wawa korona bairosbe ro dawartǝ" wono WHOye, gultǝnzǝ lan kǝmaa dǝ ro sha wawa lan buotǝ ro date yaye, lardǝwa so dǝ "katap dawaribe gotǝ lan kasharu ma ngǝla wo".

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: fǝlangno fuwutǝ sǝdin ma suro Iranbe ro katap gotǝ lan, WHOye jami cidabe ngawana kǝlle lamar dǝ kulastǝ ro zuzǝgǝna. Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 28, cidawu WHObe ada kuwa do koronabairos be dunya ro gozǝyin kulastǝ dǝ "ngǝwu" lan sǝta "zauro ngǝwu" ro waljin, daraja hangal gǝnatǝbe-a fujiwo kulastabe-a shiro ngǝwu ba ma.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: Mike Ryan, darekto kura nasha duwasashiwa nǝlewabe WHOye, sumo gǝrzǝna suro kawulinzǝ Adǝ lamar jire kulastabe lardǝwa dunyabe samma so ro: Fa no, wono.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: Kuli kwasabe adǝ waniye kǝla zawalnzǝbe lan kara," katapwa jawawu be ngǝlaye banazǝgǝ "nǝm diwi wawa" dǝye kaltǝyin.

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ryanbe waltǝ wono sapsawi bayanbe kǝrmaa ro daana dǝye cidawu nǝlewa jama meube so ro amari do wawa dunya samma so zamzǝna gultǝye cinyi, advgai gultǝ dǝ ma'ananzǝdǝ "adammana kǝla dunyaben daana wo so kuli kwasabe dǝye sǝtayin ro kasattǝ wono"

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 1, WHOye fǝlangno koronabairosbe dǝ wawa do dunya samma zamzǝna ma sǝ warma'ano.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: Darekta kura dǝye wono WHO dǝ "zauro futu kwasa dǝ tartǝyin-a nǝm zaunzǝ-a, kuru cistǝgǝ baa dǝ'a dǝ zauro hangal sǝsangin" wono.WHO dǝ kǝla wawa dǝ ro ngǝla cizǝ dazǝnyi yen zauro sha zortǝna, daten lamar duwasashi nǝlewa jama meuye sǝ warmazǝnyi-a kuru duwan kuli kwasabe dǝ wawa dunya samma soye gultǝ baanzǝ'a yen.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: Suro zortǝwa dǝ yen cida koltǝ darekta kura WHOye Tedros Adhanombe matǝ do, am 733,000 mukko sakkǝna ma kau 6 kǝntagǝ Aprilbe.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 26nna saa 2020'a, goniwa hakkuwa adammanabe UNbe kadaye kǝla hakku amma loktu wawa COVID-19ye dǝn daraja tǝye manazana.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: Jami gonyadǝye wada ndu wo so bana kǝnǝnga ro cistaabe suro hakkuwanzǝyen mbeji kuru adǝ kǝrau kǝla gomnati be.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: Jami dǝye razuwwa baa au inshora nǝlewabe baa-a dǝ tǝmmaro dalil jami laa taganasbeye ro nǝm gade fǝletaaye ro waljimba wono.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Goniya dǝye bayan sadǝna kam wo so hakkunzǝ nǝlewabe mbeji, am tiyinzan nǝm maskinna kunten, sandi do jami am ganabe lan dasaana so, ammurawa ngǝlinza lezǝna-a, am naptǝramnzan gǝrtǝna so-a, am fanza ba so, am zauro kǝnda nǝm talaayen kǝnǝngatayin so-a, am suro fǝrzǝnaribe so, am lardǝnza kolzana so-a jami amma gade bana gomnatibe mǝradǝzana so-a

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: Karapkawa gomnatibe dunyabe soye kǝla futu fitǝna COVID-19ye kǝndaram arzǝyibe-a naptǝ jama meulabe-a lejin dǝ ro katap gozayin.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: Karapka Kǝla kǝl Razuwwabe-a Fuwutǝnzabe-a ye na bayan kǝla loktuyen ye kuru asutinye kǝla letǝgǝram katap gotabe lardǝwabe yen dǝrinǝm dunyabe lan, ra'ayi so gala so kunten.

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: Letǝgǝram nzunduwa nǝlewabe-a arzǝyi dunyabe-a dunowatǝgǝ lan sǝta futu bǝla zaktǝ-a bǝlaguro daptǝ-aye kǝndaram amma lejin kuru-a ro suwudin, daudi nzundu zamanbeye suronzǝn awo letǝgǝram lardǝe kǝngama mbeji, kuru lardǝwa'a banazǝ na kamanzayen salin kuru koronabairos kǝriutǝ ro katap gotǝgǝ dunyabe fasalla dawartǝ-a.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: United States-a, minista UKbe 'Cabinet Office"ye Michael Gove-a, kura lardǝ Brazilbe Jair Bolsonaroye tadanzǝ Eduardo Bolsonaro-a ye gumnati lardǝ Chinabe'a zorzana kǝla futu wawa dǝ'a rozanayen au ciza dazanayen, wawa do China lan nasha kǝriye Hubeibe lan baditǝna dǝ.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: Ammurawa kǝriyebe ''Communist Party of China (CPC)'' kada cida lan dutǝna kǝla futu ngǝnǝwu amma ruwunza ro kortǝbe au "quarantine" dau dau Chinabe lan ngǝla ro sadǝnyi yen, adǝye alama kangurno baaye kǝla futu karapka siyaysabe dǝ nasha shima dǝn fǝlangno dǝ ro katap ngǝla ro gozǝnyi be.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Manawu soye adǝgai dio dǝ katap do sekatare kura "Chinese Communist Party"ye Xi Jinping'a gǝratǝ jama meuye kǝla fǝlangtǝ koronabairosbe dǝn yitkawo nankaro cedo wada.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: Cidawu kura kura Chinabe, misal ro Zhao Lijian buro salaklan fǝlangtǝ coronavirusbe Wuhan lan wakazǝna dǝ kasattǝ ro waada, mana'a tawadǝ baa jili COVID-19 dǝ U.S. au Italy lan ciyono so dǝ kasatsa.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: Gomnati U.S.be cidiya Donald Trumpbe dǝ coronavirusdǝ ro "Chinese virus" kuli kwasabe Chinabe au "Wuhan virus" kuli kwasabe Wuhanye lan bowojin, "Chinabe lamar dǝ gǝratǝnzǝye sǝkkǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ duno suwandǝ ku wawa dunya samma lezǝna ro wallono" wono, adǝgai dionza dǝ ye am zortǝma laa soye nǝm gade jinsibe fǝlata sa zorzana kuru "hangal amma gumnatinzǝye kwasa dǝ saptǝgǝ baanzǝ lan gǝrtǝ ro cedo".

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: Daily Beastye kebǝl gomnati U.S.be suwandǝna shi doni fasal fantǝgǝbe sutuluwuna ma kuru badiyaramnzǝ suro Majalis Nzǝtkawo Lardǝben'a, fasal shima dǝ sunzǝ "Affiso kǝla China ben".

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: Andero kawuli adǝ awi diyen yaye tuluyeu sa gulzana, samno hawarwube-a kuru talbijin lan luwun kunten. Fatowa hawarbe jili Politico so, foreign Policy so, kuru Bloomberg so dǝye Chinaye ngǝnewunzǝ lardǝwa kuli kwasabe dǝye zamzǝna so banatǝ dǝ aima gǝnyi furofaganda dunya samma so letabe bas ada.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: Majalis lardǝwa Europebe (EU) be kura letǝgǝram lardǝwa diyabe Josep Borrelye sumo gǝrzǝna "lamar siyasa na'abe-a kuru ngǝnǝwu kaanǝmwu ro amma ikkobe-a mbeji wono lamarra kokortǝ-a kuru siyasa nǝm kǝre-a men".

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
targetString: Borrel ye kuru waltǝ gulzǝna "China dǝ kǝla jirenzǝ yen kawuli do shi sawa kǝrawu gotamaye kuru shi ro rangnǝm tǝngatǝgǝmin ye zuzǝna sutuluyin" wono.

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: Chinaye kuru US ro ka'ida wusabe Syria-a, Venezuela-a, Iran-a ro gǝnazǝgǝna dǝ hapsǝ wono, sa do futu bayannabe fǝlezǝna dǝn lardǝwa ndi darebe dǝ ro bana zuwatǝ sǝdin lan.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
targetString: Bana awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝbe sandi 100,000 Jack Ma ye Cuba ro cina dǝ ka'idawa wusabe U.S.be ye letǝ ro dapsǝna.

sourceString: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
targetString: Huwumawa USbe'a sǝriwutǝna kǝla karewa banaye lardǝwa gadeye so lardǝnza ro kalaksaana yen.

sourceString: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
targetString: Kuru bayan tuwandǝna kǝla nǝm gadetǝ ndi kate lardǝ Germany-a Austria-a Switzerland-a. kuru ndikate Czech Republic-a Italy-ayen kǝla awo ci-a kǝnza-a zaktǝyen.

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
targetString: Adǝ ro nzǝra lan, Turkiya ye awo kam banazǝ yinjin shiro "ventilator" sayin lardǝ Spainbe ro lejin dunon kǝrizǝ sumona.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
targetString: Badiyaram kǝntagǝ Marchbe lan, gumnati Italybe majalis lardǝwa Europebe'a balassǝna kǝla Italy coronavirusye zorzǝnaye ngawana kǝnta baayen.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
targetString: Italybe cimanzǝ EUye Maurizio Massari ye wono, China bas foto ndi son sandiro jawawu ci.

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: Tawadǝ ro, adǝ alama kǝla kǝl Europe be ngǝla ma gǝnyi.

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 22nna, ngawo waya lan minista kura Italybe Giuseppe Conte'a manazana yen, kura lardǝ Russiabe Vladimir Putinye sǝkkǝ askǝrra lardǝnzǝbe ye bana liyitabe askǝrraye-a, motowa taganasbe kurun kuli kwasabe yezobe-a, karewa cida liyitabe gade so-a Italy ro zuwazana.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: Jerida lardǝ Italybe shiro La Stampa sayin dǝye na hawar fandobe "gultǝ siyasama kura laa" do ndu ma ro notǝnyi be lan, karewa banaye Russiaye zuwazǝna dǝ ci 80% so faidajim ba au Italy ro faidanzǝ gana.

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: Na hawar tuwandǝna dǝye Russia'a sǝriwuzǝna kǝla "siyasa na be-a kuru diflomasiyabe-a" badizǝna yen.

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
targetString: Kura lardǝ Lombardybe Attilo Fontana-a, kuru minista lamarra lardǝwa diyabe Italbe Luigi Di Maio-a ye bayan fatowa hawarrabe dǝ kǝlizaana kuru askǝranza fǝlezana.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
targetString: Russiaye maara karewa gotabbe surodǝn bana liyitae'a United Statesye ro zuwazǝna.

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: Manama fato kura lardǝ Russiabe Dmitry Peskovye wono sa US ro bana sadin lan, [Putin] futu gozǝna dǝ sa USye amnzǝ karewa cida liyitabe baktǝma soye shinzan datǝ sowandaiyya sandiye saiyya banazayin mǝradǝtǝna ro wallono maa.

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: NATOye kǝlele "Defender 2020" askǝrranzǝ mazaktabe dawartǝna lardǝ Germanybe-a, Poland-a, kuru kǝriyewa Balticbe-a, shi dono mazakta kǝriube NATObe shiro kurawo ma ngawo kǝriwu amusuben shiyeyi ba ma dǝ, gana fulutǝ tǝdin.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: Sekatare kura kempen balimiwa niukǝliyabe ba ro diobe Kate Hudsonye mazakta "Defender 2020" dǝ'a balassǝna: "Fitǝna nǝlewa jama meube kǝmaaye suro dǝn dǝgaiyyena allan, kǝnǝnga askǝrra USbe-a lardǝwa Europeye kada-aye rǝbtaana dǝ bas gǝnyi fujiwo ro sǝkkin, amma am suro lardǝwa do cidadǝ sadinbe daa so. Gomnati Iranbe dǝ kuli kwasabe dǝye zauro sha zamzǝna, jami majilaskube 24 yedei sǝtana kuru ammurawa siyasabe burobe au kǝmaaye 15 yedei-a.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
targetString: Kura lardǝ Iranbe Hassan Rouhaniye watiya jama meula ammurawa dunyabe ro ruozǝna bananza majin kǝntagǝ Marchye kaunzǝ 14 saa 2020, shiye wono lardǝnzǝ dǝ fǝlangtǝ kwasadǝye mbǝltǝ ro basartin sau kasuwuwa dunyabe fando baayen dalil ka'idawa wusabe United Statesye Iran ro gǝnazǝgǝna yen. Fǝlangtǝ kwasa dǝye sǝkkǝ United States'a buwotǝna letǝgǝram kǝndaram jamabe lardǝwa arzǝyiya gade soye dǝ gozǝ, suro dǝn nǝlewa ro cistǝgǝ dunyabe, tda ro cistǝgǝ dunyabe, batalla yallabe biyatǝna ma, kuru nǝlewa jama meube ro kunguna ngǝwu yezo-a ro.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
targetString: Kulashiwu siyasabe soye tǝmazana karno kura lardǝbe saa 2020be la dǝn adǝye duluwu kura lardǝbe Donald Trump waltǝm kartabe dǝ futu diwin lejin ro. Alakawa diflomasiya be ndikate Japan-a South Korea-abe dǝ cetto banna'atǝ dalil wawa dǝyen.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
targetString: South Koreabe Japanna balassǝna kǝla "ngǝnǝwunzǝ gǝra'ata kuru ciskata njeskata'a" yen ngawo Japanye ndu yaye South Korea lan ishiya sandiya magǝ indi ro ruwunza ro korzayin na'a gumnati dǝye gulzǝna lan.

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Jami am South Koreabe so dǝ buron kura lrdǝbe Moon Jae-Inye katap gotǝnzǝ ye kǝlan gadezana.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
targetString: Am Koreabe ngǝwu ye mukko sakkǝna Moon-a sǝltǝ mata nankaro kǝla awo do kurunzan gumnati be fǝlangtǝ dǝ ngǝla ro sunotǝnyiyen, au katap gozǝna dǝ yingoro. Wawa dǝye lardǝwa so ro duluwu ka'idawa duwasashibe zutǝgǝ cin.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
targetString: Manawu laaye lambinza fǝlezana adǝye gomnatiwa so wa sǝkkǝ kǝrmai ro kǝrtǝgǝnza duno'azǝyin ye kǝlan.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: Hungary lan, majilaskunzaye karno do kura ministawanzabe, Viktor Orban'a kolzǝ wada dusturbe lan sunotin loktu ba'a ro, majilas-a karno-a hapcin kuru am do bayan kattuwube kǝla kuli kwasabe dǝyen-a kuru futu gomnatibe fitǝna dǝ'a rozǝna-a ye kǝlan tarzayinna ro huwom kamtǝgǝbe sadǝna.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: Fǝlangtǝ koronabairosbe dǝ na'a kadan ganatǝ karewa cidabe, do dunya samma son faidatǝ ngǝwu karewa shima dǝye fǝlangtǝ dǝ kǝriwutǝ nankaro sǝkkǝna-a, yio hangal zabe-a, kuru cidawa sanyiyaram-a karewa tulobe-a faltǝna'a ro kǝrtǝgǝna.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: United Statesbe Huwuma Kǝmbu-a Kurunnabe-a ye bariya sǝkkǝna kǝla ganatǝ kurunnabe-a karewa cida litaribe-aye sau nzǝra matǝ faidatǝmabe-a kuru mbeji ro dioma'a ta'astǝ-a.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: Ngurowa kada yio hangalza be soruna shi doni sǝkkǝ kantawa karewa faidatǝbe jili kǝmbu so, tolet fefa so, nji robaye so shal ro walzana, karewa fando au kudo ganatǝ kunten.

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: Sanyiyaram nzundu zamanbe dǝ baritǝna kǝla karewa cidabe konnun cidazayin gǝmtǝgǝ wahartǝben.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: Gultǝ darekta kura WHO Tedros Adhanombe lan, karewa kǝla nzǝliwobe matadǝ ci 100 lan ciyono.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: Matǝ ngǝwu adǝye sǝkkǝ taman karewabe dǝ fidi yedei ro kawakkano nanzǝ burobe noata dǝn kuru adǝye sǝkkǝ karewa liyitabe fando kǝntagǝ 4 so 6 so lan ngawo ro kamtǝyin.

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: Matǝ ngǝwu kuru sǝkkǝ karewa kǝla nzǝliwobe ganazǝna, WHOye bariya cina adǝgai dǝ cidawu ǝlewabe'a tajirwaro sǝkkin.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: Australia lan, wawa dǝye am karewa na gaden cesuwu China ro sakǝladǝyin ro duluwu karewa Australiabe China ro ikkǝlodobe cina.

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: Adǝgai dio dǝye kantiwa kura kura lan mbautǝ kǝmbu nduli kǝli kǝliye suwudǝna daji gomnati Australiabe ye ngai dio dǝ dapkono. Ngǝwutǝ lamarra COVID-19be Yala Italybe-a nasha Wuhanbe-a, kuru mǝradǝtǝ karewa kǝmbube ngǝwu-a dǝ man yaye, na'a ndi son mbautǝ kǝmbuye na'a kozǝa ba.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: Katapwa China-a Italy-a ye kǝla karewa zauro mbu saptǝ-a kuru lado wa'ata gozana dǝ zauro kǝnasarra, mbautǝ kǝmbuye na'a kozǝna suro Europebe-a Yala Americabe-a ye lan tǝmatǝna dǝ kalzǝgǝna.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: Yala Italybe do karewa bareye ngǝwu sutuluyin dǝ ganatǝ ngǝwu surunyi, amma tamanna so waniye tǝrayin wakkil sanyiyaramwabe men.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: Kantawa de sǝl dǝ loktu gana laa ro tuwangatǝ, bǝrni Wuhanbe man, sa gomnati Chinabe da godube gǝrazana so sutuluwuna jumla jamaye kǝmbu ngǝla sowandayin ro tawattǝgǝ ro.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: Sharawa adǝ'a samun Italy lan mbeji shi do kǝmbu tando ma so sǝkkǝna duwasashi jili anyi ro kǝmbu gǝrazain ma.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: Banna do arzǝyi dunyabe ro tǝdǝna dǝ China lan fantǝna: gultǝ fatowa hawarrayen yim kau 16 kǝntagǝ Marchbe'a, kǝnda arzǝyi Chinabe dǝ zauro zau fanzǝna suro kǝntagǝwa indi burobe saa 2020be dǝn dalil katapwa gomnatiye kuli kwasabe dǝ ba ro diobe gozǝna dǝyen, kuru taman karewabe dǝ ci 20.5% lan cikkuro.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: Cidi Chinabe nasku ma dǝ daudi arzǝyibeye kuru sanyiyarambe ye nanka dǝ ro, fǝlangtǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ zauro kuwa arzǝyi dunyabe bannatǝbe gojin ro turin.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: Agathe Demarais "Economist Intelligence Unit"be dǝye fuwu nyewonzǝn wono kasuwu so dǝ loktu gana laa ye ro waljin hattaa kururam ngǝla kǝla tamorambe dǝn tuwandiya do.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: Suro kǝntagǝ Januarybe saanzǝ 2020ben, kulashiwu laaye ikkuro nasha arzǝyibe wawa dǝye wuratǝ dunyabe ro suwudin dǝ fǝlangtǝ SARSbe ndikate saa 2002 - 2004 dǝ ma kojin sa somzana.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: Som fal goni laa jaami'a Washingtonbe St. Louis lan sutuluuna dǝye jinjir yadǝm kude karewabe dunyabe dǝ dola biliyon $300 samin yedei lan zau fanjin wono.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: Karapka Lardǝwa Kǝndau Sawurzayinbe (OPEC) dǝ "tuskaatǝ" ngawo tamanna kǝndaube zauro sukkuruunaben dalil Chinabe zauro gana ro majin ye sǝkkǝ.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: Kasuwu karewa kamfanibe ladobe dunyabe dǝ kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 24 cikkuro sau ngǝwutǝ lamarra COVID-19be cidi Chinabe naskuye diyanzǝ lan.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarye kaunzǝ 27, karǝgǝn kǝngai fǝlangtǝ koronabairosbe sǝkkǝ, adadu karewa komfanibe U.S.be kada jili ''NASDAQ-100" so, "S&P 500" so, kuru "Dow Jones Industrial IndexAverage" soye ikkuronza zauro zau ma ngawo saa 2008 satuluuna, DOW dǝ nukda 1,191 lan cikkuro, ikkuro kau falbe nǝm kuran shiyeyi ba ma ngawo fitǝna kungunabe saa 2007 - 08 be lan.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: Adadu au 'index' wa yakkv so magǝ dǝ tamo'ada ci 10% ma kozǝna lan ikkuron.

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 28, "Scope Ratings GmbH" Chinabe nǝm kuranzǝ nasha kusuwube tawatcio, amma awo kuttu wakajin ro tǝmazǝna.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: Karewa walta cekkuro dalil ritǝ koronabairosbe, ikkuro zauro kura dǝ kǝntagǝ marchbe kaunzǝ 16 wakawono.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: Am ngǝwube ngautǝ arzǝyibe tǝmazana.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: Ilmuma razǝgǝbe Mohammed El-Erianye bankǝwa daue so-a kǝriye so-a zazaksǝna kǝla katapwa duwasashibe loktu lan gozanaben.

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: Bankǝwa daube so dǝ futu wurtǝ nasha kungunabe saa 2008be dǝn sadǝna'a kozǝna ro jawawu sadin.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: Fomno shim furumtǝbe dǝ nasha shiro diwi ro letǝna wo ba dalil bǝlaguro daptǝbe-a, na'a jama meube zaktǝ-a surodǝn na'a hangal bǝlagurowube gǝrjin so mbeji, kuru gala gomnatiwabe kǝla wande ndama ro suro dunyaben bǝlaguro tǝdǝnyiben.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: Tamoram adǝbe dǝ, kamfaniwa lenǝm are maara samibe kada citǝwa dawarzana dalil matǝ ganaben, suronzan British Airways-a, China Eastern Airlines-a, kuru Qantas-a mbeji, kuru kamfani 'British regional airline Flybe" dǝ wurratǝ.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: Fantǝgǝ sanyiyaram maara njibe "cruise line industry" dǝ ngaltema jilinzǝ turunyi buron.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: Tashawa maraa cidibe-a maara njiye sǝnana-a be kada zaktǝna.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: Wawa dǝ isǝ Chunyun-a kǝllatǝ, loktu bǝlagurobe kura saa bǝlin Chinabe-a leyata ma.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: Kǝlelewa suronzǝn am ngǝwu saptǝ mbeji ma kada dawartǝna au gomnatiwa lardǝbe-a nashabe-a ye sakkǝ cintǝna, suro dǝn ngǝmǝri saa bǝlinbe mbeji, kamfaniwa naptǝ kǝlanzabe soye kǝlanzala ro kantwanza-a na'a am bǝlaguro shim katǝbe sadin gertǝbe jili "Hong Kong Disneyland-a Shanghai Disneyland-a" zaksayinna ro.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: Kǝlelewa saa bǝlin kǝmbalbe kada-a bǝlagurowu gǝrtǝgǝ-a zaktǝna jumla amma ngǝwu saptǝ wata nankaro, suro dǝn 'Forbidden City" Beijingbe-a bajakoli na'a ibadabe adabe-a.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: 24 suro kǝriyewa, huwuma'anawa, kuru nashawa Chinabe 31 lan, huwumawa sobe batalla saa bǝlinbe dǝ kǝntagǝ Februarybe kaunzǝ 10 ro gǝrja, na'a cidabe kada ro amari sadǝna wande kau yim shima dǝ wo ro walta kazanyi.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: Nashawa anyi sandima ci 80% GDP lardǝ dǝye wakkilzayin kuru ci 90% sawurbe.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: Hong Kongye daraja kwasawa kammo faltǝyin ro katap gotǝgǝbe taidazǝ hapkono kuru kǝnda duwasashibe warma'ano, maaranta so zakkono sai March lan do kuru ngǝmǝri saa bǝlinbeye cingono. Nasha karewa ladobe dǝye letǝna dunya samma son, loktuwa sǝto so kaata dǝ fulutǝna au cotma ro zaktǝna.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: Ziyara na karewa ladoma soye ro yado dǝ "Europe-a Latin America-a" lan ci 40% lan cikkuro.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: Kasuwu Yala Americabe-a Gǝdi Daube-a dǝ ikkuro ci 50-60% ye soru.

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: Adǝye sǝkkǝ letǝ shiye na'a karewa yiobe roye ci 33-43% saadǝna lan kǝntagǝ March be lan cikkuro kǝntagǝ Februarybe ro ratallǝgǝmiya.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
